thread.title: The #BodegaStrike is giving New Yorkers all the feels
thread.title_full: The #BodegaStrike is giving New Yorkers all the feels

author: Sasha Lekach
title: The #BodegaStrike is giving New Yorkers all the feels
text:
Grabbing a pack of gum on the way back from the subway Thursday won't be easy as normal for New Yorkers. But they arenâ€™t getting mad â€” instead, theyâ€™re snapping photos and showing love to their neighborhood bodegas on social media.
SEE ALSO: A Syrian journalist's ordeal after Trump's travel ban
Instagram and Twitter have been filling up with #BodegaStrike photos as people stand in solidarity with an estimated 1,000 neighborhood grocers, a protest organized by the local Yemeni-American community against Donald Trump's travel ban .
#BodegaStrike makes me SO PROUD to be a New Yorker. Honored to pray with my Muslim brothers and sisters. #nomuslimban #NoBanNoWall
â€” Jessie Standafer (@jessiestandafer) February 2, 2017
A friend just texted me from a bodega in Brooklyn. pic.twitter.com/4wgS0BP8mT
â€” kate sullivan (@teadrunkkate) February 2, 2017
#bodegastrike
A photo posted by Manda (@manz_duh86) on Feb 2, 2017 at 10:14am PST
#bodegastrike pic.twitter.com/rYrYeXK1XN
â€” katie ðŸŒ¹ (@katieraffa) February 2, 2017
When taxi drivers & bodega workers strike, that's powerful: they're the cultural fabric of NYC. Let's stand with them! #bodegastrike âœŠ pic.twitter.com/m4Qlg99Ik1
â€” Lucky Tran (@luckytran) February 2, 2017
#IStandWithMyBodegaGuys #myyemenineighbor https://t.co/ZBWEYsNNh2 pic.twitter.com/ZAIFEdnLvb
â€” Philip Leff (@philipleff) February 2, 2017
Even New York City mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted his solidarity with bodega owners.
New York City's bodega owners are bravely shutting their doors to oppose the president's shameful executive order. I stand with them. pic.twitter.com/TXT90Lrqii
â€” Bill de Blasio (@NYCMayor) February 2, 2017
On top of the moving images of closed shops, a rally with business owners and other Yemeni-Americans and supporters drew a big crowd Thursday afternoon. Demonstrators even showed up hours before the event and held a prayer session.
When Arabs are two hours early for an event! #UnifyandDefy #BodegaStrike pic.twitter.com/OpFC3SQhS8
â€” Widad (@WidadIndie) February 2, 2017
Thousands are at #Brooklyn Borough Hall to pray, to protest, to be #patriotic . These are the faces of #MyMuslimNeighbor . We #UnifyANDDefy . pic.twitter.com/H3F4ESWCmc
â€” Eric Adams (@BPEricAdams) February 2, 2017
One of the most powerful demonstrations I've ever seen #bodegastrike pic.twitter.com/NM95aN3irG
â€” Christopher Mathias (@letsgomathias) February 2, 2017
In a news release about the strike and rally, organizers said the store shutdown hopes to show "the vital role these grocers and their families play in New Yorkâ€™s economic and social fabric and, during this period, grocery store owners will spend time with their families and loved ones to support each other; many of these families have been directly affected by the Ban."
The strike is also giving New York neighbors all the feels.
My god. The bodega strike is giving me chills. So, so beautiful. America is for everyone. #BodegaStrike #MyYemeniNeighbor
â€” mcgrupp (@gratefulmaggzzz) February 2, 2017
